intro: Wulffia baccata var. discoidea, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and elliptic in shape, with a smooth surface. The flowers are small and inconspicuous, while the fruits are fleshy and contain a single large seed.
